task.title: How to Get the Machine Started

taskbody.prereq:
The following steps will help you get the ice cream maker started.
Goal: Get ice cream machine started
Audience: Student or faculty in Shanks
Materials: Machine and included components, moist cloth, desired ingredients for recipe
Do not fill the freezer bowl higher than 1/2 inch from the top. The ingredients will increase in volume during the freezing process, and this machine yields two quarts or less of whatever is made.

step.cmd: Put freezer bowl in the coldest part of freezerl it must be completely frozen before preparing recipe, freezing time is usually between 12 and 24 hours.

substep.cmd: (Optional) Leave your freezer bowl in the freezer at all times for convenience. You can take it out at any time for immediate use.

step.cmd: Assemble desired ingredients to use in machine

substep.cmd: For best results, prepare ingredients in a container from which it is easy to pour

step.cmd: Remove freezer bowl from freezer and place it on the center of the base unit

substep.cmd: Bowl will begin to defrost quickly once it has been removed from freezer. Use immediately after removal.

step.cmd: Place mixing arm in freezer bowl, it should not fit tighly but it rests in the center of the bowl, circle side facing up
Place lid on base, oriented to the right of center

substep.cmd: Turn clockwise to lock. Easy-lock lid allows lid to rest on said base.

step.cmd: Plug in machine to electric socket

substep.cmd: Once the unit is plugged in, each function button should light up

step.cmd: Select desired function: "Ice Cream," "Gelato," or "Sorbet;" See Figure 1
Pour ingredients into bowl through ingredient spout in Easy-lock lid
